result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Scott Ryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Scott Ryan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Scott Ryan was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Nicholas Scott Ryan was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation by December 18, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Defendant is eligible for expungment on Counts 2 and 4 upon successful completion of Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
-Follow treatment as recommended.
-Random and regular testing.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle   DF:  Nicholas Scott Ryan appeared. Includes 14TR5675, 14TR5676, 14TR5677, 15CF423, 15CT101, 15TR1653, 15CF49. Case called at 4:29 pm. Counsel has reached an agreement. ADA Minser recites agreement. Atty. O'Boyle confirms.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2 and 4 in 15CF49 and G to Ct 2 in 15CT101. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and 4 in 15CF49 and Ct 2 in 15CT101. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Cts 1, 3 and 5 in 15CF49, all Cts in 15CF423, 15TR1653, 14TR5675, 14TR5676, 14TR5677 and Ct 1 in 15CT101. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
15CF49 - Cts 2 and 4 - S/W 18 mos Probation with conditions:
-treatment as recommended
-random/regular testing
-Absolute Sobriety
-40 hours community service
-court costs for each count, $243
Report to probation by 12/18/15 by 4:00 pm

15CT101 - 14 month revocation, credit for admin suspension
-10 days jail, with 1 day credit, to commence no later than 2/12/16 by 6:00 pm (with Huber for employment)
-$1,379 fine + $52 for blood draw
-AODA  and Driver's Safety
-Money on file, applied to costs

15CF49 - Cts 2 and 4 eligible for expungement upon successful completion and application

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  John M. O'Boyle, DF:  Nicholas Scott Ryan appeared. Includes MH 15CF49 and 15CT101, 14TR5675, 14TR5676, 14TR5677 and 14TR1653. S/T Officer Ryan Miller. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. S/T Sgt. Dishno. Direct by ADA Minser. Cross by Atty O'Boyle. Redirect. Attorney argument. Court denies motion and Attorney's to speak to JA (tomorrow) to set hearing for trial. Address is confirmed and bond continued.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

-Maintain residence with mother.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Jennifer Anne Bork, NONA by def. State requests warrant. Court issues warrant body only. Court defaults TR's and enters NC plea on all 3 TR's and finds Defendant guilty of 14TR5675 with a fine of $761.50, 6 mo rev, AODA and Driver safety plan, on 14TR5677 guilty with a fine of $213.10 and guilty on 14TR5677 with a fine of $263.50 and 30 days to pay all fines.
